pull.title: update getnetworkinfo help with subversion
pull.body:
- add missing subversion field to getnetworkinfo help
- fix style and format errors in help string
- remove unneeded int cast

events.body: @laanwj Can you verify this is correct now?

events.message:
update getnetworkinfo help with subversion

- add missing subversion field to getnetworkinfo help
- fix style and format errors in help string
- remove unneeded int casts

events.body:
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4982_b5ec5fe0cb0a85cb626167b66fdda3bed8c5ba19/ for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.
Can we have this merged then?

comments.body:
Then please let's fix our sources once via clang-format.
Anyway... I've reverted them.

That will happen at some point. It just gets a bit annoying to have to remind you of this with every commit.
Diffs are much easier to review if you only change the lines that actually sensibly change (as you did now, thanks).
It's a brain fuckup on my side, sorry! I still hope we get to a state where clang-format is applied :).

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -368,23 +368,29 @@ Value getnetworkinfo(const Array& params, bool fHelp)
             "Returns an object containing various state info regarding P2P networking.
"
             "
Result:
"
             "{
"
-            "  "version": xxxxx,           (numeric) the server version
"
-            "  "protocolversion": xxxxx,   (numeric) the protocol version
"
-            "  "localservices": "xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx",   (string) the services we offer to the network
"
-            "  "timeoffset": xxxxx,        (numeric) the time offset
"
-            "  "connections": xxxxx,       (numeric) the number of connections
"
-            "  "networks": [               (array) information per network
"
-            "      "name": "xxx",        (string) network (ipv4, ipv6 or onion)
"
-            "      "limited": xxx,         (boolean) is the network limited using -onlynet?
"
-            "      "reachable": xxx,       (boolean) is the network reachable?
"
-            "      "proxy": "host:port"  (string) the proxy that is used for this network, or empty if none
"
-            "    },
"
+            "  "version": xxxxx,                      (numeric) the server version
"
+            "  "subversion": "/Satoshi:0.9.3/",     (string) the server subversion string
"
comments.body: May be better to use /Satoshi:x.x.x/ here, to avoid people updating this every version
